title: Problem 2103_C
statement: The median of an array b_1, b_2, ... b_m, written as \operatorname{med}(b_1, b_2, ..., b_m), is the ≤ft\lceil \frac{m}{2} \right\rceil-th^{\text{∗}} smallest element of array b.You are given an array of integers a_1, a_2, ..., a_n and an integer k. You need to determine whether there exists a pair of indices 1 ≤ l < r < n such that:\operatorname{med}(\operatorname{med}(a_1, a_2, ..., a_l), \operatorname{med}(a_{l+1}, a_{l+2}, ..., a_r), \operatorname{med}(a_{r+1}, a_{r+2}, ..., a_n)) ≤ k.In othe

sample_tests.output:
YES
NO
NO
YES
YES
YES
